person.persName: Robert Aitcheson Alexander (Very wealthy Woodford Co, KY livestock breeder)

body.p: Residence: Woodford County, Kentucky. English-born son of Robert Alexander and Eliza Richardson. Owned "Woodburn" stock farm in Woodford County, Kentucky. Woodburn was the largest breeding establishment in the world, according to an 1867 newspaper report, where cattle, horses, and sheep were bred on this five thousand-acre estate. Alexander's herds included pure bred shorthorn cattle and Southdown sheep, both of which he began to import from England in 1850 and which gave his livestock holdings a national reputation. Also owned race horses. One of the wealthiest men in the United States at the time of his death in 1867. In addition to Woodburn, owned a large property in central Illinois, several blocks in Chicago, and a seventeen thousand-acre "mineral tract" in Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, located in the Adrie Iron Works of America.
